name: EvaProtocol
description:
A station management AI has gone rogue! The residents of the station are evacuating.

However, to successfully evacuate, the Main control room of the station should be powered on. And, to make things worse, the same room contains the terminal for a missile launch.

You are an emergency response bot, which was tasked with maintaining a constant power supply to the Main Control Room. To accomplish this, you have to constantly install a new package of emergency batteries to the station's generators.

Unfortunately, the station's AI knows this, and sends the androids to apprehend you. Fortunately, as per Asimov's rules, the standard servitor bots still have the non-direct harm protocols enabled. However, they can still catch you and make the station's power go out by itself.

Avoid them, use your wits, manage your time and the space around you. Make sure your mission is a success. Game has 2 possible endings (for a good one, survive 6 waves)

Controls:

WASD for movement
Mouse - camera control 

E - interact (pick up items)

Some footage: https://youtu.be/axmcq40FdE0

Epic 2021 Megajam submission (Running out of space, in many ways, ehe):

1) You have a limited amount of inventory space for batteries and have to plan your movements carefully

2) Enemies can swarm you in waves, the station is running out of space for maneuvers

3) Humans are evacuating (literally running out of space)


Additional assets used :

1)SpaceShipinterior and Modular Scifi : Scifi mesh for generator, retractable gates, keycard holder, table, beams/some of the columns

2) M5VFXVOL2: Fire

3) Bossy enemy walk/run cycle

4) Advanced Glass Pack materials for glass

5) Kitbash Epic Megajam building type E

6) StarSphere Skybox for space

7)Advanced Cel Shader for some minor stylizing

Everything else, including music, custom voiceover, mechanics, and interior were prepared for this jam by our team on the spot. Although it is our first jam, we hope that this short game would be fun to play with. 

Future plans: We could potentially expand upon the mechanics and many more modes (physical traps and so on). Let us know if you have any suggestions!
